docs.title: Home
docs.text:
Wildcat

Graphical Uniden BC125AT programmer for Linux

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text:
• WILDCAT_NO_DRIVER Prevents wildcat from executing the driver on startup
  • WILDCAT_SERIAL_PORT Sets the serial port wildcat will use to connect to your scanner

docs.title: Step 1. Clone the repo
docs.text:
First clone the repo using

git clone https://github.com/Interfiber/Wildcat.git

docs.title: Step 2. Clone the dependencies
docs.text: Now inside of the Wildcat folder use the installdeps.sh script to clone required dependencies

docs.title: Step 4. Install
docs.text:
sudo sh install.sh

Now wildcat has been installed to /usr/local and can be launched using wildcat or using its installed desktop launcher entry

docs.title: Failed to open serial device from: /dev/ttyACM[...]
docs.text:
This usually occurs when you are not in the dialout group, you can add yourself to this group using:

sudo usermod -a -G dialout $(whoami)

Then logout to apply the changes

docs.title: The font looks pixelated!!
docs.text: This might be because resource couldn't be loaded, make sure all font files are located in /usr/local/share/wildcat/resources/fonts

docs.title: I don't have root access! How can I use wildcat?
docs.text: Sadly wildcat requires root access in order to run the wildcatdriver, this executable only needs to be ran once for every machine boot. If you can get a superuser to execute this file then you can set WILDCAT_NO_DRIVER to disable launching the driver

docs.title: My scanner is on a serial port other than 0!
docs.text: You can set the environment variable WILDCAT_SERIAL_PORT to the port number in order to change this!

docs.title: Wildcat could not find a suitable polkit wrapper to use!
docs.text: Please make sure you have pkexec, or kdesu installed and in your PATH

docs.title: I have a problem which isn't listed here!
Submit
docs.text: To add files to this database send a PR to github and add them to the wcat folder
